comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: Per street view (and geograph project) there's not a lot left...

comment.author: 29492435@N02
comment._content: Thanks, Nice to see what it looked like as only the platforms are left now. The Derry/Londonderry train still goes through the station but the branch line from Limavady to Dungiven closed in 1952. I'll try and get a photo of it from this position to compare after work. Up until now the only view of the station I could find was this computer representation. eiretrains.com/Photo_Gallery/Irish%20Trainz/Limavady%20Ju...

comment.author: 29492435@N02
comment._content: On second thoughts the links posted by [http://www.flickr.com/photos/20727502@N00] show just how little is left of this once busy station. The station was opened by the Londonderry and Coleraine Railway as Newton Junction on 1 March 1855. It was renamed Limavady Junction on 1 October 1875. At that time, new station buildings were provided to designs by the architect John Lanyon. It closed on 17 October 1976 and the buildings demolished in the early 1980's.
